acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 48 hours EC50>=89.1mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (SIDS (2004) and others.).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 593mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2000-50 (2001)) representing the lower of the two testing data, 593mg/kg and 599mg/kg (SIDS (2004)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hours) value of 20ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of vapour) of 0.31mg/L (ATSDR (1998)), 0.06mg/L (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)), 0.124mg/L, 0.31mg/L and 0.15mg/L (SIDS (2004)), was lower that 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (70ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 0.007 kPa (25degC) (CERI Hazard Data 2000-50 (2001)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 747mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 738mg/kg, 960mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2000-50 (2001)), 746mg/kg, 959mg/kg (SIDS (2004)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible given the insufficiency of data for use in classification, along with the absence of existing classification.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =117mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2281) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 140degC (open cup flash test) (ICSC (2004))

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in SIDS (2004).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 454degC (ICSC,2004)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproductive capacity of parental animals and development of filial generation, described in SIDS (2004).

respiratory_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause allergy or asthma symptoms or breathing difficulties if inhaled
respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the descriptions of human health effects in CERI Hazard Data 2000-50 (2001), MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003) and ACGIH (7th, 2001): "The substance induces allergic asthma, irritable pneumonia and contact hypersensitivity."

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests performed in accordance with OECD Test Guideline 405 (SIDS (2004)): "eye corrosive substance."

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests performed in accordance with OECD Test Guideline 404 (SIDS (2004)): "skin corrosive substance." The substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety if further subclassification is needed.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests (SIDS (2004)): "Positive." Also due to the fact that the substance is classified into "Skin Sensitizing Substance" by the ad hoc committee of the Japanese Society of Occupational Allergy.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "eye, nasal and respiratory irritation, coughing, chest discomfort" (CERI Hazard Data 2000-50 (2001)), and the evidence from animal studies including "tracheal inflammation, turbinate epithelial necrosis, hyperplasia of squamous epithelium in turbinate," "pulmonary epidermal hyperplasia, pneumonitis, coagulation of histiocytes, degeneration of nasal olfactory epithelium, hyperkeratosis, inflammation or ulceration" following inhalation exposure to rats (CERI Hazard Data 2000-50 (2001)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies: "the clinical symptoms of inhalation exposure to rats included pulmonary edema and pneumonia" (ATSDR (1998)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
